content:
The error "Student cannot be resolved to a type" suggests that the Java compiler does not recognize the class called "Student". This could occur for several reasons, such as:

1. The class "Student" has not been defined in the code.
2. The class "Student" is defined in a different package than the package of the current code.
3. The class "Student" has been defined in the code but has not been compiled or imported.

To resolve this error, you should check if the class "Student" has been defined in the code and that it has been compiled or imported correctly. If the class "Student" is defined in a different package, you may need to import it in the current code using the "import" statement. For example, if the "Student" class is defined in the "com.example" package, you can import it as follows:
```arduino
import com.example.Student;
```
If the "Student" class has not been defined in the code, you will need to define it before you can use it. You can create a new class called "Student" and define its properties and methods as required.
